original_title: Debate grows over college students carrying Narcan kits back to campus | Fox News
article_summary: College parents are sending Narcan, a medication used to reverse opioid overdoses, to their children as part of 'health kits'. However, there's debate over students' ability to effectively administer the drug and potential legal implications. Some universities have 'good Samaritan policies' to protect students who intervene in drug overdose situations. The panelists emphasized the need for education and prevention in the ongoing opioid crisis.</s>
